episodeTitle: An Explosive Situation! Luffy vs. Fake Luffy!

alternateTitles.english: A Hair-Trigger! Luffy vs. Fake Luffy

description: The real Luffy confronts his imposter Demaro Black on Sabaody Archipelago. After being shot at, Luffy demonstrates his post-timeskip power by dodging with Observation Haki and knocking out the fake crew with Conqueror's Haki. Meanwhile, Chopper mistakes the fake crew for his real friends, Sanji learns about his crewmates from Shakky, and Zoro accidentally boards the wrong ship.

events.title: Demaro Black (Fake Luffy) Confronts Real Luffy
events.description: Fake Luffy, revealed to be Demaro Black, confronts the real Luffy in the streets of Sabaody Archipelago. He demands an apology for bumping into him and threatens violence.
events.significance: Sets up the demonstration of Luffy's post-timeskip Haki abilities and establishes the fake Straw Hat crew as a problem on Sabaody.

quotes.text: You bumped into me! Apologize now or face the consequences!
quotes.speaker: Fake Luffy (Demaro Black)
quotes.context: Fake Luffy trying to intimidate the real Luffy

events.title: Luffy's First Post-Timeskip Haki Demonstration
events.description: When Fake Luffy shoots at him, Luffy dodges the bullet using Kenbunshoku Haki (Observation Haki) and then releases a burst of Haoshoku Haki (Conqueror's Haki), instantly knocking out the entire fake crew and surrounding onlookers.
events.significance: First demonstration of Luffy's mastery of Haki after the two-year timeskip, showing his tremendous growth in power. This establishes that Luffy has achieved one of the goals of his training with Rayleigh.

quotes.text: I don't have time for fakes.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's dismissive attitude before demonstrating his Haki

events.title: Demaro Black's True Identity Revealed
events.description: After being knocked out by Luffy's Haki, the Marines and Sentomaru arrive. PX-5 reveals that Fake Luffy is actually 'Three-Tongued' Demaro Black with a bounty of 26,000,000 berries.
events.significance: Reveals the imposter's true identity and shows how much weaker he is compared to the real Luffy's 400,000,000 berry bounty.

quotes.speaker: PX-5
quotes.context: Pacifista revealing Fake Luffy's true identity

events.title: Chopper Meets the Fake Straw Hats
events.description: Chopper encounters Fake Sanji, Fake Zoro, and Fake Robin and initially mistakes them for his real crewmates. However, he quickly realizes they are imposters due to their vastly different personalities and behavior.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's naivety but also his genuine connection to his real crewmates. The fake crew attempts to recruit him, thinking he's an abandoned pet.

quotes.text: Sanji! Zoro! Robin! I found you!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper's initial excitement before realizing they're fakes

events.title: Sanji Learns About Crew's Training
events.description: At Shakky's Rip-off Bar, Sanji learns from Shakky that all the Straw Hats except Luffy and Robin have already arrived at Sabaody. She tells him about Zoro heading toward Fish-Man Island on the wrong ship.
events.significance: Provides exposition about the crew's reunion timing and sets up Zoro's comedic subplot. Shows Sanji's concern for his crewmates.

quotes.text: That green-haired fool got on the wrong ship again!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's exasperated reaction to hearing about Zoro's directional incompetence

events.title: Zoro Cuts Ship in Half
events.description: A pirate ship suddenly surfaces from underwater, cut completely in half. Zoro is revealed to be on the mast, having accidentally boarded the wrong ship that was heading toward Fish-Man Island underwater.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's increased strength post-timeskip, showing he can effortlessly cut an entire ship in half. Also showcases his continued directional problems in a humorous way.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's casual reaction after destroying the ship he mistakenly boarded

events.title: Caribou and Coribou Join Fake Straw Hats
events.description: The notorious Caribou Brothers - 'Wet Hair' Caribou (bounty: 210,000,000) and 'Blood-Splatterer' Coribou (bounty: 190,000,000) - are revealed to have joined the Fake Straw Hat Crew, though their true intention is to kill the real Straw Hats from the inside.
events.significance: Introduces two significant antagonists who will play important roles in the Fish-Man Island arc. Shows the danger of the fake crew's recruiting scheme.

events.title: Marines and Pacifista Arrive
events.description: After Luffy knocks out the fake crew, Sentomaru arrives with Pacifista units PX-5 and PX-7 to apprehend the criminals. The Marines begin engaging with the remaining conscious pirates.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming conflicts and shows the Marine response to pirate activity on Sabaody. Foreshadows the Pacifista battles to come.

events.title: Public Reaction to Real vs Fake Luffy
events.description: The citizens and pirates on Sabaody are confused when confronted with both the real and fake Luffy. They try to determine which is genuine while encouraging the real Luffy to apologize to avoid conflict.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's growing fame and notoriety that someone would impersonate him. Demonstrates public perception of the Straw Hats two years after their disappearance.

quotes.text: Just apologize! You don't want to mess with Straw Hat Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Civilian
quotes.context: Civilians trying to protect the real Luffy from the fake, not knowing which is which

events.title: Boa Hancock Departs from Luffy
events.description: Boa Hancock and the Kuja Pirates prepare to depart from Sabaody after safely transporting Luffy back to the archipelago. Hancock reluctantly says goodbye to Luffy.
events.significance: Shows Hancock's continued affection for Luffy and marks the end of his journey from Amazon Lily back to Sabaody.

quotes.text: I don't have time for fakes.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Before demonstrating his Haki on the fake crew

quotes.speaker: PX-5
quotes.context: Revealing the fake Luffy's true identity

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: After cutting a ship in half that he mistakenly boarded

themes.description: The episode showcases Luffy's tremendous growth after the two-year timeskip through his effortless use of Haki to defeat the imposters.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between the fake and real Luffy symbolizes the gap between reputation and reality, and how Luffy has grown to match and exceed his reputation.

themes.description: The existence of fake Straw Hats shows how famous the crew has become, with people willing to impersonate them for power and influence.
themes.symbolism: The fake crew represents the superficial understanding of strength and piracy, while the real Straw Hats embody genuine bonds and earned power.

themes.description: The episode builds anticipation for the Straw Hats' reunion, showing various crew members arriving at Sabaody and preparing to set sail together again.
themes.symbolism: Each crew member's individual arrival represents their personal growth and journey during the separation.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his mastered Haki abilities for the first time post-timeskip, showing his tremendous growth. He handles the fake crew situation with confidence and minimal effort.
keyActions: Knocks out entire fake crew with Conqueror's Haki
quotes: I don't have time for fakes.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows Zoro's increased strength by casually cutting a ship in half, while maintaining his comedic directional incompetence.
keyActions: Boards wrong ship heading to Fish-Man Island

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates Chopper's naivety and his genuine bond with his crewmates by quickly seeing through the fakes despite initial confusion.
keyActions: Mistakes fake crew for real crew
Escapes from fake crew's recruitment attempt
quotes: Sanji! Zoro! Robin! I found you!

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji learns about his crewmates' whereabouts and shows concern for the crew's reunion, particularly worried about Zoro's directional problems.
quotes: That green-haired fool got on the wrong ship again!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several scenes for pacing, including Chopper's interaction with the fake crew and Sanji's conversation with Shakky.
Some dialogue and reactions from civilians are anime-original additions to emphasize the confusion between real and fake Luffy.

trivia.fact: This episode marks Luffy's first demonstration of Conqueror's Haki in a controlled manner, showing his mastery of the ability he first unconsciously used at Amazon Lily and Marineford.
The episode adapts portions of manga chapters 598 and 599, which are part of the Return to Sabaody Arc spanning chapters 598-602.

sources.title: Return to Sabaody Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Demaro Black's epithet 'Three-Tongued' is a play on the expression 'two-tongued' (meaning duplicitous), emphasizing his deceitfulness even further.
This episode aired on October 9, 2011, with a Funimation simulcast one day earlier on October 8, 2011, showing the increasingly global simultaneous release strategy.
The episode did not feature an ending theme song, as One Piece stopped using ending themes after episode 278 (which aired in 2006). All credits were shown during the opening theme.
